member.name: T:DDInt.Common.CEM
member.summary: The CEM (shorthand for CommonErrorManagement) is a set of static methods for raising exceptions through a standard manner. By using these methods to raise exceptions, we can trace all exceptions thrown by the common layer, obtain error strings from a resource file and map error conditions to the appropriate exception.

TimestampEscape ::= _LeftBrace _TS _StringLiteral ...
Validate the time/date/timestamp value, since the parser only recognizes a string literal. The contents of the string literal were not checked.

Returns the year (yyyy) value for the yyyy-mm-dd or yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss[.f...] escape formats; null, otherwise.
@return the year value for ODBC 'd' and 'ts' escapes; null, otherwise.

Returns the month (mm) value from the yyyy-mm-dd or yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss[.f...] escape formats; null, otherwise.
@return the month value for ODBC 'd' and 'ts' escapes; null, otherwise.

Returns the day (dd) value from the yyyy-mm-dd or yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss[.f...] escape formats; null, otherwise.
@return the day value for ODBC 'd' and 'ts' escapes; null, otherwise.

Returns the hour (hh) value from the hh:mm:ss[.f...] or yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss[.f...] escape formats; null, otherwise.
@return the hour value for ODBC 't' and 'ts' escapes; null, otherwise.

Returns the minutes (mm) value from the hh:mm:ss[.f...] or yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss[.f...] escape formats; null, otherwise.
@return the minutes value for ODBC 't' and 'ts' escapes; null, otherwise.

Returns the seconds (ss) value from the hh:mm:ss[.f...] or yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss[.f...] escape formats; null, otherwise.
@return the seconds value for ODBC 't' and 'ts' escapes; null, otherwise.

Returns the time value in the ODBC format (hh:mm:ss[.f...]).
@return the time value in the ODBC format.

Returns the date value in the ODBC format (yyyy-mm-dd).
@return the date value in the ODBC format.

member.name: T:DDInt.Common.CommonTrace
member.summary: The Connect for .NET Provider supports tracing through the CommonTrace class. The provider can trace all of its method calls and the returns from those method calls to a trace file specified by the user.

member.name: M:DDInt.Common.CommonTrace.SetEnableTrace(System.Int32)
member.summary: The EnableTrace() property enables tracing. The default is 0 (disabled).

member.name: M:DDInt.Common.CommonTrace.DumpFootprints
member.summary: The DumpFootprints() method displays the footprint of all source files in a data provider.

member.name: P:DDInt.Common.CommonTrace.TraceFile
member.summary: The TraceFile property gets or sets the name of the trace output file.

Used to record positions of certain UPDATE/INSERT statemet clauses.
!!!REVISIT!!! Instead of recording positions of various clauses in the sqlProcessor, create a BaseSQLTreeNode nodes that encapsulate the meaning and search for it when processing the semantics of the statement. For example, BaseSQLTreeNode.NODE_TABLE_NAME node could be used to identify an UPDATE statement's table.
!!!REVISIT!!! Note that current check to see if sqlProcessor is null are no longer needed. In the past replaced clauses were re-parsed (e.g., escape translations). This is still true, but the parse level is always PROCESS_PARAMS, so no UPDATE/INSERT clauses are ever parsed.

* Parses the Statement non-terminal. * * Statement * ::= SelectStatement * NODE_STATEMENT_ROOT * $1 * * ::= InsertStatement * NODE_STATEMENT_ROOT * $1 * * ::= UpdateStatement * NODE_STATEMENT_ROOT * $1 * * ::= CreateStatement * NODE_STATEMENT_ROOT * $1 * * ::= DeleteStatement * NODE_STATEMENT_ROOT * $1 * * ::= UnknownStatement * NODE_STATEMENT_ROOT * $1

Parses the StatementList non-terminal.
StatementList ::= Statement StatementSeparator _EndOfStatementTerminal $1 -> [$2] -> $3
::= Statement StatementSeparator StatementList $1 -> [$2] -> $3
::= _EndOfStatementTerminal $1

Parses the CreateStatement non-terminal.
CreateStatement ::= _CREATE_TABLE AlmostAnything NODE_CREATE_STATEMENT $1 $2

Parses the SelectStatement non-terminal.
SelectStatement ::= QueryExpression OrderByClause ForClause NODE_SELECT_STATEMENT $1 -> [$2] -> [$3]

Parses the QueryExpression non-terminal.
QueryExpression ::= _SELECT List FromClause WhereClause GroupByClause HavingClause SetOperation NODE_QUERY_EXP $1 -> $2 -> [$3] -> $4 -> [$5] -> [$6] -> [$7]

Parses the DeleteStatement non-terminal.
DeleteStatement ::= _DELETE _FROM QualifiedName WhereClause NODE_DELETE_STATEMENT $1 -> $2 -> $3 -> $4

Parses the InsertStatement non-terminal.
InsertStatement ::= _INSERT _INTO QualifiedName ColumnList _VALUES ParenthesizedExpression NODE_INSERT_STATEMENT $1 -> $2 -> $3 -> [$4] -> $5 -> $6
::= _INSERT _INTO QualifiedName ColumnList SubQuery NODE_INSERT_STATEMENT $1 -> $2 -> $3 -> [$4] -> $5
::= _INSERT _INTO QualifiedName ColumnList _DEFAULT _VALUES NODE_INSERT_STATEMENT $1 -> $2 -> $3 -> [$4] -> $5 -> $6

Parses the UpdateStatement non-terminal.
UpdateStatement ::= _UPDATE QualifiedName _SET List WhereClause NODE_UPDATE_STATEMENT $1 -> $2 -> $3 -> $4 -> $5

Parses the QualifiedName non-terminal.
QualifiedName ::= _IdentifierOrUnknownKeyword(false) [ _Dot ... _IdentifierOrUnknownKeyword(false) ] ... NODE_UNKNOWN $1 -> [ $2 -> ... ]

Parses the UnknownStatement non-terminal.
UnknownStatement ::= UnknownStatementComponents NODE_UNKNOWN_STATEMENT $1

Parses the UnknownStatementComponents non-terminal.
UnknownStatementComponents ::= _EndOfStatementTerminal $1
::= _Parameter UnknownStatementComponents $1 -> $2
::= Escape UnknownStatementComponents $1 -> $2
::= _AnyToken UnknownStatementComponents $1 -> $2

Parses the List non-terminal.
List ::= AlmostAnything(true,false) NODE_LIST_PART $1

Parses the PredicateType non-terminal.
PredicateType ::= ComparisonPredicate ::= BetweenPredicate ::= InPredicate ::= LikePredicate ::= ExisitsPredicate

Parses the ComparisonPredicate non-terminal.
ComparisonPredicate ::= ValueExpression CompOp ValueExpression
CompOp ::= _Equal
::= _LessThan
::= _LessThanOrEqual
::= _GreaterThan
::= _GreaterThanEqual
::= _Unequal

Parses the BetweenPredicate non-terminal.
BetweenPredicate ::= ValueExpression BetweenExpression ValueExpression _And ValueExpression
BetweenExpression ::= Not_opt _Between

Parses the SetOperationLastPart non-terminal.
SetOperationLastPart ::= QueryExpression NODE_UNKNOWN $1
::= AlmostAnything(true,false) NODE_UNKNOWN $1

Parses the SetOperator non-terminal.
SetOperator ::= _UNION $1
::= _INTERSECT $1
::= _EXCEPT $1

Parses the ParenthesizedExpression non-terminal.
ParenthesizedExpression ::= _LeftParen AlmostAnything(false,true) _RightParen NODE_PAREN_ROOT $1 -> $2 -> $3

Parses the SubQuery non-terminal.
SubQuery ::= _LeftParen QueryExpression _RightParen NODE_PAREN_ROOT $1 -> $2 -> $3

Parses the Escape non-terminal.
Escape ::= CallEscape $1
::= FunctionEscape $1
::= OuterJoinEscape $1
::= TimeEscape $1
::= DateEscape $1
::= TimestampEscape $1
::= EscapeEscape $1

Parses the TimeEscape non-terminal.
TimeEscape ::= _LeftBrace _T _StringLiteral _RightBrace // Reduction only valid if FULL_TRANSLATION_NEEDED // is required for the TIME escape. NODE_TIME_ESCAPE $1 -> $2 -> 3 -> 4
::= _LeftBrace _T RestOfEscape NODE_UNKNOWN $1 -> $2 -> 3...

Parses the DateEscape non-terminal.
DateEscape ::= _LeftBrace _D _StringLiteral _RightBrace // Reduction only valid if FULL_TRANSLATION_NEEDED // is required for the DATE escape. NODE_DATE_ESCAPE $1 -> $2 -> 3 -> 4
::= _LeftBrace _D RestOfEscape NODE_UNKNOWN $1 -> $2 -> 3...

Parses the TimestampEscape non-terminal.
TimestampEscape ::= _LeftBrace _TS _StringLiteral _RightBrace // Reduction only valid if FULL_TRANSLATION_NEEDED // is required for the TIMESTAMP escape. NODE_TIMESTAMP_ESCAPE $1 -> $2 -> 3 -> 4
::= _LeftBrace _TS RestOfEscape NODE_UNKNOWN $1 -> $2 -> 3...

Parses the EscapeEscape non-terminal.
EscapeEscape ::= _LeftBrace _ESCAPE _StringLiteral _RightBrace // Reduction only valid if FULL_TRANSLATION_NEEDED // is required for the ESCAPE escape. NODE_ESCAPE_ESCAPE $1 -> $2 -> 3 -> 4
::= _LeftBrace _ESCAPE RestOfEscape NODE_UNKNOWN $1 -> $2 -> 3...

Parses the FunctionEscape non-terminal.
FunctionEscape ::= _LeftBrace _FN _ScalarFunctionName EscapeParameterList _RightBrace // Reduction only valid if FULL_TRANSLATION_NEEDED // is required for the FUNCTION escapes. NODE_FUNCTION_ESCAPE $1 -> $2 -> $3 -> $4 -> $5
::= _LeftBrace _FN RestOfEscape NODE_UNKNOWN $1 -> $2 -> $3...
Unless full translation is needed, the sub-tree is marked NODE_UNKNOWN, since the it will not require further translation work.

Parses the CallEscape non-terminal.
CallEscape ::= _LeftBrace _CALL QualifiedName EscapeParameterList _RightBrace // Reduction only valid if FULL_TRANSLATION_NEEDED // is required for the CALL_PROCEDURE escapes. NODE_CALL_PROCEDURE_ESCAPE $1 -> $2 -> $3 -> $4 -> $5
::= _LeftBrace _CALL RestOfEscape NODE_UNKNOWN $1 -> $2 -> $3...
::= _LeftBrace _Parameter _EqualOperator _CALL QualifiedName EscapeParameterList _RightBrace // Reduction only valid if FULL_TRANSLATION_NEEDED // is required for the CALL_FUNCTION escapes. NODE_CALL_FUNCTION_ESCAPE $1 -> $2 -> $3 -> $4 -> $5 -> $6 -> $7
::= _LeftBrace _Parameter _EqualOperator _CALL RestOfEscape NODE_UNKNOWN $1 -> $2 -> $3 -> $4 -> $5...
Common CallEscape endings are parsed via parseRemainingCallEscape.

Parses the OuterJoinEscape non-terminal.
OuterJoinEscape ::= _LeftBrace _OJ OuterJoin _RightBrace // Reduction only valid if FULL_TRANSLATION_NEEDED // is required for the OUTER_JOIN escapes. NODE_OUTER_JOIN_ESCAPE $1 -> $2 -> $3 -> $4
::= _LeftBrace _OJ RestOfEscape NODE_UNKNOWN $1 -> $2 ->3...
Unless full translation is needed, the sub-tree is marked NODE_UNKNOWN, since the it will not require further translation work.

Parses the OuterJoinOrTableReference non-terminal.
OuterJoinOrTableReference ::= OuterJoin $1
::= TableReference $1

Parses the JoinType non-terminal.
JoinType ::= _LEFT _OUTER _JOIN NODE_LEFT_OUTER_JOIN_OP $1 -> $2 -> $3
::= _RIGHT _OUTER _JOIN NODE_RIGHT_OUTER_JOIN_OP $1 -> $2 -> $3
::= _FULL _OUTER _JOIN NODE_FULL_OUTER_JOIN_OP $1 -> $2 -> $3
The method updates the type of the node as well.

Parses the TableReference non-terminal.
TableReference ::= QualifiedName CorrelationName NODE_TABLE_REFERENCE $1 -> [$2]

Looks ahead for certain join related keywords.
The state of the parser is unaffected by this method.

Parses the SearchCondition non-terminal.
SearchCondition ::= AlmostAnything(true,false); NODE_SEARCH_CONDITION $1
A search condition is everything up to the next ON keyword or until the end of the escape is encountered.

Parses the EscapeParameters non-terminal.
EscapeParameters ::= EscapeParameter _Comma EscapeParameters $1 -> $2 -> $3
::= EscapeParameter $1

Parses the EscapeParameter non-terminal.
EscapeParameter ::= EscapeParameterComponents NODE_ESCAPE_PARAMETER $1
A parameter is everything up to the next comma or right paren.

Parses the RestOfEscape non-terminal.
RestOfEscape ::= _EndOfStatementTerminal $1
::= _RightBrace(translationNeeded) $1
::= Escape RestOfEscape(translationNeeded) $1 -> $2
::= _Parameter RestOfEscape(translationNeeded) $1 -> $2
::= _AnyToken RestOfEscape(translationNeeded) $1 -> $2

Parses the GROUP BY terminals.
_GROUP_BY ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("group") TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("by") $1 $2

Matches the HAVING terminal.
_HAVING ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("having") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the ORDER BY terminals.
_ORDER_BY ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("order") TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("by") $1 $2

Matches the UNION terminals.
_UNION ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("union") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the INTERSECT terminals.
_INTERSECT ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("intersect") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the EXCEPT terminal.
_EXCEPT ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("except") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the BY terminal.
_BY ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("by") NODE_UNKNOWN

Parses the CREATE TABLE terminals.
_CREATE_TABLE ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("create") TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("table") $1 $2

Matches the SELECT terminal.
_SELECT ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("select") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the FROM terminal.
_FROM ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("from") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the WHERE terminal.
_WHERE ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("where") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the NOT terminal.
_WHERE ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("not") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the NULL terminal.
_NULL ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("null") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the EXISTS terminal.
_WHERE ::= TOKEN_ID_OR_KEYWORD("exists") NODE_UNKNOWN

Matches the BETWEEN terminal.

Indirection to the escape translator in case one was not provided.

Extracts parameter metadata identifying information for all predicates
Algorithm :
- Make a pass through the tree gathering all param nodes
- For each parameter node, search back up the tree towards the root looking for nearest predicate ancestor if any - adding such predicates to a list
- For each predicate node, identify the part of the predicate that can be used to describe the parameters contained in the predicate. Each predicate type has specific logic/code for determing this.
- Parameter metadata descriptions can be in two forms. It can be a sub query which produces a single value. Or it can be "anything else". If its a sub query, then the sub query minus anything past the 'where' clause describes the parameter. If it's not a sub query, then the "anything else" is used as column description in a secondary select statement built from the parts of the enclosing select statement.
If its a sub query, construct a new "where 0=1" select statement out of the sub query.
If its "anything else" construct select statement the enclosing select as the basis, with the "anything else" part as the column definition. Again with a "where 0=1" clause.
If an escape node is visited, then translate and replace the escape sub-tree.

member.name: T:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlBulkCopyOptions
member.summary: Bitwise flag that specifies one or more options to use with an instance of PsqlBulkCopy.

member.name: T:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlBulkCopy
member.summary: Lets you efficiently bulk load a SQL Server table with data from another source.
member.remarks:
Microsoft SQL Server includes a popular command-prompt utility named bcp for moving data from one table to another, whether on a single server or between servers. The PsqlBulkCopy class lets you write managed code solutions that provide similar functionality. There are other ways to load data into a SQL Server table (INSERT statements, for example), but PsqlBulkCopy offers a significant performance advantage over them.
The PsqlBulkCopy class can be used to write data only to SQL Server tables. However, the data source is not limited to SQL Server; any data source can be used, as long as the data can be loaded to a DataTable instance or read with a IDataReader instance.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlBulkCopy.ColumnMappings
member.summary: Returns a collection of PsqlBulkCopyColumnMapping items. Column mappings define the relationships between columns in the data source and columns in the destination.
member.remarks:
If the data source and the destination table have the same number of columns, and the ordinal position of each source column within the data source matches the ordinal position of the corresponding destination column, the ColumnMappings collection is unnecessary. However, if the column counts differ, or the ordinal positions are not consistent, you must use ColumnMappings to make sure that data is copied into the correct columns.
During the execution of a bulk copy operation, this collection can be accessed, but it cannot be changed. Any attempt to change it will throw an InvalidOperationException.

member.name: T:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlBulkCopyColumnMapping
member.summary: Defines the mapping between a column in a SQLServerBulkCopy instance's data source and a column in the instance's destination table.
member.remarks:
Column mappings define the mapping between data source and the target table.
If mappings are not definedâ€”that is, the ColumnMappings collection is emptyâ€”the columns are mapped implicitly based on ordinal position. For this to work, source and target schemas must match. If they do not, an InvalidOperationException is thrown.
If the ColumnMappings collection is not empty, not every column present in the data source has to be specified. Those not mapped by the collection are ignored.
You can refer to source and target columns by either name or ordinal. You can mix by-name and by-ordinal column references in the same mappings collection.

member.name: M:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlBulkCopyColumnMappingCollection.Clear
member.summary: Clears the contents of the collection.
member.remarks:
The Clear method is most commonly used when you use a single PsqlBulkCopy instance to process more than one bulk copy operation. If you create column mappings for one bulk copy operation, you must clear the PsqlBulkCopyColumnMappingCollection after the WriteToServer method and before processing the next bulk copy.
Performing several bulk copies using the same PsqlBulkCopy instance will usually be more efficient from a performance point of view than using a separate PsqlBulkCopy for each operation.

If you create column mappings for one bulk copy operation, you must remove mappings that no longer apply after the WriteToServer method is called and before defining mapping for the next bulk copy. You can clear the entire collection by using the Clear method, or remove mappings individually using the Remove method or the RemoveAt method.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlCommand.ArrayBindCount
member.summary:
Specifies the number of rows of parameters that will be used. The application must set this property before executing a command that uses parameter array binding. The count must equal the length of each of the arrays that is set for each parameter value.
When set to 0 (the default), the application will not use parameter array binding.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlCommand.ArrayBindStatus
member.summary: Returns an array of row status values. This property can be used to check status after executing a command that used array binding. This property will return null when array binding is not used. Pervasive's array binding is done as a single atomic operation. Either all rows are successful or all rows will fail. When an array bind execution fails, the first row in the parameter array that caused the failure will be marked with the best appropriate status. All other status will be marked as failed.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.IsFixedSize
member.summary: Overridden. Gets a value that indicates whether the PsqlConnectionStringBuilder has a fixed size.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.AlternateServers
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of alternate database servers to which the data provider will try to connect if the primary database server is unavailable. Specifying a value for this property enables connection failover for the data provider.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the Alternate Servers connection string option.

The value you specify must be in the form of a string that defines connection information for each alternate server. For the Pervasive PSQL data provider, you must specify the port number and the name or the IP address of each alternate server.
The string has the format:

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.DatabaseName
member.summary: Gets or sets the internal database name of the database to which you want to connect. Use this property when you need to connect to a Pervasive PSQL data source for which a ServerDSN has not been defined.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.Encoding
member.summary:
Specifies an IANA name or Windows code page number to be used for translating the string data stored in the database.
The default value is an empty string; the current Windows Active Code Page (ACP) is used.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.Encrypt
member.summary:
Determines whether the data provider uses Encrypted Network Communications, also known as wire protocol.
When set to always, the data provider uses encryption. If set to never, the data provider does not use encryption.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.Encryption
member.summary: Determines the minimum level of encryption allowed by the data provider. The default is medium, which corresponds to 56-bit encryption when using the default encryption module. Other values are low and high.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.Host
member.summary:
Gets or sets either the name or the IP address of the server to which you want to connect. For example, if your network supports named servers, you can specify a server name such as Psql Server. Or, you can specify an IP address such as 199.226.224.34.
To use a PSQL server running on the local machine, specify localhost.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.InitialCommandTimeout
member.summary: This option can be used to override the default command timeout of 30 seconds.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.InitializationString
member.summary: Specifies one statement that will be issued immediately after connecting to the database to manage session settings. The initial default is an empty string.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.LongDataChunkSize
member.summary: The amount of long data to assemble and send to server in a single packet.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.LoadBalancing
member.summary: Determines whether the data provider uses client load balancing in its attempts to connect to primary and alternate database servers. The list of alternate servers is specified by the Alternate Servers property.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.Port
member.summary: Gets or sets the TCP port of the listener running on the Pervasive PSQL database.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the Port connection string option.
The initial default is 1583.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.PVTranslate
member.summary: Specifies whether connection will check the Pervasive server encoding to use.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.ServerDSN
member.summary:
The name of the data source on the server, such as ServerDSN=SERVERDEMO.
The default value is DEMODATA.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.Timestamp
member.summary: Specifies whether Pervasive TimeStamps are stored and retrieved as strings in the ADO.NET data provider.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.TimeType
member.summary: Specifies whether Pervasive Times are retrieved as Timespan or DateTime in the ADO.NET data provider.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.ConnectionReset
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that pecifies whether a connection that is removed from the connection pool for reuse by an application will have its state reset to the initial configuration settings of the connection.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the Connection Reset connection string option.
When set to False (the initial default), the data provider does not reset the state of the connection.
Resetting the state impacts performance because the new connection must issue additional commands to the server, for example, resetting the current database to the value specified at connect time.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.ConnectionRetryCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of times the data provider tries to connect to the primary server, and, if specified, the alternate servers after the initial unsuccessful attempt.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the Connection Retry Count connection string option.
The value can be any integer from 0 to 65535.
When set to 0 (the initial default), the data provider does not try to reconnect after the initial unsuccessful attempt.
If a connection is not established during the retry attempts, the data provider returns an error that is generated by the last server to which it attempted to connect.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.ConnectionRetryDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds the data provider waits after the initial unsuccessful connection attempt before retrying a connection to the primary server, and, if specified, the alternate servers.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the Connection Retry Delay connection string option.
The value can be any integer from 0 to 65535.
The initial default is 3 (seconds). When set to 0, there is no delay between retrying the connection.
NOTE: This property has no effect unless the ConnectionRetryCount property is set to an integer greater than 0.

This property and the ConnectionRetryCount property, which specifies the number of times the data provider attempts to connect after the initial unsuccessful attempt, can be used in conjunction with connection failover.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds after which the attempted connection to the Pervasive PSQL server will fail if not yet connected. If connection failover is enabled, this option applies to each connection attempt.
member.remarks:
This property corresponds to the Connection Timeout connection string option.
When set to 0, the data provider never times out on a connection attempt. The initial default is 30 seconds.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.EnableTrace
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether tracing is enabled. The initial default is False.
member.remarks: During debugging, sensitive data can be read, even if it is stored as a private or internal variable, and access is limited to the same assembly. To maintain security, trace logs show passwords as five asterisks (*****).

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.LoadBalanceTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds to keep connections in a connection pool. The Min Pool Size property can cause some connections to ignore this value.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the Load Balance Timeout connection string option.
The value can be any integer from 0 to 65535. When set to 0 (the initial default), the connections have the maximum timeout.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.MaxPoolSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of connections within a single pool. When the maximum number is reached, no additional connections can be added to the connection pool. The value can be any integer from 1 to 65535.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the Max Pool Size connection string option.
The initial default is 100.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.MaxStatementCacheSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of statements that can be held in the statement cache. Setting the cache size to 0 will disable statement caching.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the Max Statement Cache Size connection string option.
The initial default is 10.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.MinPoolSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum number of connections are opened and placed in a connection pool when it is created. The connection pool retains this number of connections, even when some connections have exceeded their Load Balance Timeout value.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the Min Pool Size connection string option.
The value can be any integer from 0 to 65535.
When set to 0 (the initial default), no additional connections are placed in the connection pool when it is created.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.ParameterMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the parameter mode, The parameter mode controls the parameter marker format and the whether parameters are bound ordinally or by name.
member.remarks: This property corresponds to the Parameter Mode connection string option.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets a case-insensitive password used to connect to your Pervasive PSQL database.
member.remarks: This property corresponds to the Password connection string option.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.PersistSecurityInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether to display secure information in clear text in the ConnectionString property of the Connection object.
member.remarks:
This property corresponds to the Persist Security Info connection string option.
When set to true, the value of the Password connection string option is displayed in clear text.
When set to false (the initial default), the data provider does not display secure information in clear text.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.Pooling
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether connections are pooled.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the Pooling connection string option.
When set to true (the initial default), connection pooling is enabled.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.SchemaCollectionTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds after which the attempted schema collection operation to the Psql server will fail if not yet completed.
member.remarks:
This property corresponds to the Schema Collection Timeout connection string option.
When set to 0, the data provider never times out on a schema collection operation attempt. The initial default is 120 seconds.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.SchemaOptions
member.summary: Bit flags that can be used control the amount of schema information returned by the GetSchema method.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.SocketReceiveBufferSize
member.summary: Sets the socket receive buffer size. The default (0) implies the provider should use pre-set optimal value. -1 implies the provider should use the OS default.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.SocketSendBufferSize
member.summary: Sets the socket send buffer size. The default (0) implies the provider should use the pre-set optimal value. -1 implies the provider should use the OS default.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.StatementCacheMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the statement cache mode, The statement cache mode controls the behavior of the statement cache. Statements can be cached automatically or only cached when a command is explicitly marked.
member.remarks: This property corresponds to the Statement Cache Mode connection string option.

summary.para: Gets or sets the path and name of the trace file.
The initial default is \\PVSW_NETTrace.txt. If the trace file does not exist, the data provider creates it.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.UseCurrentSchema
member.summary: Indicates whether the schema collections should automatically restrict using the current schema when the schema restriction is omitted.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlConnectionStringBuilder.UserID
member.summary: Gets or sets the default user name used to connect to your Psql database.
member.remarks: This property corresponds to the User ID connection string option.

member.name: T:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlDataReader
member.summary: The PsqlDataReader class allows you to retrieve a read-only stream of rows from a database. The PsqlDataReader does not cache data in memory, which makes it a good choice when you must retrieve large amounts of data. Because only one row is in memory at any given time, system overhead is reduced.

member.name: T:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlTrace
member.summary: The data provider supports tracing through the PsqlTrace class. The data provider can trace all of its method calls and the returns from those method calls to a trace file specified by the user.

member.name: M:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlTrace.DumpFootprints
member.summary: Displays the footprint of all source files in a data provider.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlTrace.EnableTrace
member.summary: Enables tracing. By default, tracing is not enabled.
member.remarks: Setting EnableTrace starts the tracing process. Therefore, you must define the property values for the trace file before you enable tracing. Once the tracing process starts, the values of the TraceFile and RecreateTrace properties cannot be changed.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlTrace.TraceFile
member.summary: Specifies the path and name of the trace file.
member.remarks:
TraceFile is a provider-specific method of the PsqlTrace class.
The initial default value is \PsqlTrace.txt. If the trace file does not exist, the data provider creates it.

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlTrace.RecreateTrace
member.summary: Recreates the trace file each time the application restarts. By default, the trace file is appended.

member.name: M:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlTransaction.Commit

member.name: M:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlTransaction.Rollback

member.name: P:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.PsqlTransaction.IsolationLevel

member.name: T:Blowfish_NET.Blowfish
member.summary: Blowfish ECB implementation
member.remarks: Use this class to encrypt or decrypt byte arrays or a single block with Blowfish in the ECB (Electronic Code Book) mode, they key length can be flexible from zero up to 56 bytes.

member.name: F:Blowfish_NET.Blowfish.MAXKEYLENGTH
member.summary: maximum (and recommended) key size in bytes

member.name: F:Blowfish_NET.Blowfish.BLOCKSIZE
member.summary: block size in bytes
member.remarks: (please note that data has to be aligned to the block size)

member.name: M:Blowfish_NET.Blowfish.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: standard constructor
member.param: the key material, up to MAXKYELENGTH bytes, oversized material is ignored

member.name: M:Blowfish_NET.Blowfish.Burn
member.summary: deletes all internal data structures and invalidates this instance
member.remarks: Call this method as soon as the work with a particular instance is done. By this no sensitive translated key material remains. The instance is invalid after this call and usage can lead to unexpected results.
member.returns: self reference

member.name: M:Blowfish_NET.Blowfish.SelfTest
member.summary: executes a selftest
member.remarks: Call this method to make sure that the instance is able to produce valid output according to the specification.
member.returns: true: selftest passed / false: selftest failed

member.name: M:Blowfish_NET.Blowfish.Encrypt(System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: encrypts a single block
member.remarks: Use this method to encrypt one logical block, which is passed as two 32bit halves. If you extract the block from a sequence of bytes you have to do it in the network byte order.
member.param: reference to the high 32 bits of the block
reference to the low 32 bits of the block
member.returns: self reference

member.name: M:Blowfish_NET.Blowfish.Encrypt(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: encrypts single bytes
member.remarks: Use this method to encrypt bytes from one array to another one. You can also use the same array for input and output. Note that the number of bytes must be adjusted to the block size of the algorithm. Overlapping bytes will not be encrypted. No check for buffer overflows are made.
member.param: input buffer
output buffer
where to start reading in the input buffer
where to start writing to the output buffer
number ob bytes to encrypt
member.returns: self reference

member.name: M:Blowfish_NET.Blowfish.Decrypt(System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: decrypts a single block
member.remarks: Use this method to decrypt one logical block, which is passed as two 32bit halves. If you extract the block from a sequence of bytes you have to do it in the network byte order.
member.param: reference to the high 32 bits of the block
reference to the low 32 bits of the block
member.returns: self reference

member.name: M:Blowfish_NET.Blowfish.Decrypt(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: decrypts single bytes
member.remarks: Use this method to decrypt bytes from one array to another one. You can also use the same array for input and output. Note that the number of bytes must be adjusted to the block size of the algorithm. Overlapping bytes will not be decrypted. No check for buffer overflows are made.
member.param: input buffer
output buffer
where to start reading in the input buffer
where to start writing to the output buffer
number ob bytes to decrypt
member.returns: self reference

member.name: T:Pervasive.Data.SqlClient.Lna.ResultCacheConst
member.summary:
Manages fetching, caching, and navigation of a result set. Provides most of the functionality of a JDBC ResultSet except for datatype conversion.
For consistency with SQL and JDBC, all row and column indices are 1-based.
Implementers of this interface need to do the following validation:
in getObject, check range of columnIndex, throw exception if necessary
in updateObject, if cache is not updatable throw exception
in updateObject, check range of columnIndex, throw exception if necessary
